rocks.bastion.core.builder

Interface BindBuilder

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    BastionBuilder<MODEL>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BastionBuilderImpl

    public interface BindBuilder
    Defines the operations that can be performed on a Bastion builder before it has been bound to a model type. Binding the builder to a model type allows Bastion to interpret the received response to a Java object of the specified type. Once a builder is bound, later calls on the builder will provide a constructed instance of the model object which was bound. This is useful, for example, if you would like to perform assertions on a Java object rather than a raw HTTP response or a JSON string.

    Since at this point we don't know what type of model the builder was bound to, then there is only one operation defined in this interface, namely:
    • bind(Class): Specify which class type to use when constructing a model of the received response. Bastion will interpret and decode the received response object into an instance of whatever type is supplied to this method.
    Once bound, you will have access to an AssertionsBuilder which contains the model type you specified in the bind(Class) method. This will allow you to continue preparing your test by method chaining.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      <MODEL> AssertionsBuilder<? extends MODEL> bind(Class<MODEL> modelType)
      Binds the specified class type to this Bastion builder.

    • Method Detail

      • bind

        <MODEL> AssertionsBuilder<? extends MODEL> bind(Class<MODEL> modelType)
        Binds the specified class type to this Bastion builder. Although not necessarily required by Bastion, you should pass in a constructable type (a non-abstract class which can be instantiated) because the various decoders used by Bastion, such as the Jackson JSON parser, only work if it can construct an instance of the model.

        The bound type will be used further on when the user specifies assertions, callbacks or outright retrieves the decoded response model as the bound model (of the correct type) will be provided by Bastion.
        Type Parameters:
        MODEL - The type of model to bind this builder to
        Parameters:
        modelType - A non-null class type which will be used when constructing the response model
        Returns:
        A builder bound to the specified model type. Use this to continue chaining method calls and specify your Bastion test even further
